thread.title: Police question Cleveland Browns quarterback Johnny Manziel in domestic dispute involving alcohol
thread.title_full: Police question Cleveland Browns quarterback Johnny Manziel in domestic dispute involving alcohol

author: Seattle Times staff
title: Police question Cleveland Browns quarterback Johnny Manziel in domestic dispute involving alcohol
text:
Police question Cleveland Browns quarterback Johnny Manziel in domestic dispute involving alcohol Originally published October 16, 2015 at 8:40 pm Updated October 16, 2015 at 8:47 pm Cleveland quarterback Johnny Manziel was questioned by police after witnesses saw him arguing on the side of a highway with his girlfriend and pulling her back into his car as she tried to exit the vehicle. He admitted he had consumed alcohol. By Seattle Times staff The Associated Press 
CLEVELAND – Cleveland Browns quarterback Johnny Manziel was questioned by police after witnesses saw him arguing on the side of a highway with his girlfriend and pulling her back into his car as she tried to exit the vehicle. 
Manziel, 22, admitted to police he had consumed alcohol before the dispute. 
The 2012 Heisman Trophy winner, who spent 10 weeks in a rehab facility during the offseason, was parked in a gravel driveway Monday when Avon, Ohio, police spoke to him after an argument with his girlfriend, Colleen Crowley. 
Manziel wasn’t arrested and Crowley told police she didn’t want to press charges against him. The couple was allowed to leave the scene together. Most Read Stories
